This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            {anomaly-jobs-cap} sort all data by a user defined time field which is accessed 
          
          
            
            frequently. If the time field is a {ref}/runtime.html[runtime field], the small 
          
          
            
            performance overhead of the runtime field may become significant which slows 
          
          
            
            down the job. Please consider using an indexed field as a time field.
          
          
            
            {anomaly-jobs-cap} sort all data by a user-defined time field, which is frequently 
          
          
            
            accessed. If the time field is a {ref}/runtime.html[runtime field], the 
          
          
            
            performance impact of calculating field values at query time can significantly slow
          
          
            
            the job. Use an indexed field as a time field when running anomaly detection jobs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -235,6 +235,16 @@ When you create an {anomaly-job}, you cannot use a field with the
 `data_description` object. This limitation applies irrespective of whether you
 create jobs in {kib} or by using APIs.
 
+[float]
+[[ml-limitations-runtime]]
+== {anomaly-detect-cap} performs better on indexed fields
+
+{anomaly-jobs-cap} sort all data by a user defined time field which is accessed 
+frequently. If the time field is a {ref}/runtime.html[runtime field], the small 
+performance overhead of the runtime field may become significant which slows 
+down the job. Please consider using an indexed field as a time field.

nodes.bodyText: Made some clarifying suggestions, namely to indicate that calculating the values at query time is what might slow jobs. Also suggest stronger wording to "Use an indexed field" rather than considering it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -235,6 +235,16 @@ When you create an {anomaly-job}, you cannot use a field with the
 `data_description` object. This limitation applies irrespective of whether you
 create jobs in {kib} or by using APIs.
 
+[float]
+[[ml-limitations-runtime]]
+== {anomaly-detect-cap} performs better on indexed fields
+
+{anomaly-jobs-cap} sort all data by a user defined time field which is accessed 
+frequently. If the time field is a {ref}/runtime.html[runtime field], the small 
+performance overhead of the runtime field may become significant which slows 
+down the job. Please consider using an indexed field as a time field.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -235,6 +235,16 @@ When you create an {anomaly-job}, you cannot use a field with the
 `data_description` object. This limitation applies irrespective of whether you
 create jobs in {kib} or by using APIs.
 
+[float]
+[[ml-limitations-runtime]]
+== {anomaly-detect-cap} performs better on indexed fields
+
+{anomaly-jobs-cap} sort all data by a user-defined time field, which is frequently 
+accessed. If the time field is a {ref}/runtime.html[runtime field], the 
+performance impact of calculating field values at query time can significantly slow
+the job. Use an indexed field as a time field when running anomaly detection jobs.
